backend/main.mo: Defines the main canister with access control, storage mixins, and data models for benches, documents, components, users, and related query/update APIs.
backend/migration.mo: Implements a migration ensuring all user profiles include required dashboard sections by updating the userProfileMap.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented features, associated files, components, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose and behavior of major frontend files and utilities.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base style definitions with OKLCH color variables for light and dark themes and global styling rules.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML entry point containing the root element and script bootstrapping the React application.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Sets up TanStack Router, authentication gates, layout, and protected routes within the themed application wrapper.
Empty file placeholder for admin access control component.
frontend/src/components/AppErrorBoundary: React error boundary that displays a fallback UI and reload option when runtime errors occur.
frontend/src/components/auth/ActorGate.t: Wraps children in backend-actor initialization logic, showing loading or error states when actor creation fails.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Ensures a user is authenticated before rendering children, showing loading or error messages accordingly.
frontend/src/components/dnd/DraggableLis: A generic draggable list component rendering items with drag handlers and visual feedback during reordering.
frontend/src/components/dnd/useDraggable: Hook managing drag-and-drop item reordering, tracking dragged index and updating item order.
Main application shell with navigation, theme toggle, logout handling, and responsive layout structure.
frontend/src/components/navigation/Scrol: Displays scroll-to-top and scroll-to-bottom buttons based on current scroll position.
frontend/src/components/profile/EntityTa: Input component for selecting or typing a single entity tag with suggestion filtering and removal.
frontend/src/components/profile/Predefin: Grid selector for choosing from predefined avatar images with labels and visual selection state.
frontend/src/components/profile/UserAvat: Renders a user avatar from predefined or custom sources, with cache busting and size options.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Hook creating and managing backend actors based on identity and invalidating dependent queries when changed.
Zustand store providing a cache-busting timestamp and method to refresh it.
frontend/src/hooks/useDashboardChartType: Hook storing and persisting dashboard chart type preference in localStorage.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Context and provider for managing Internet Identity authentication, login state, and identity loading.
Hook periodically updating the user's last-seen timestamp via the backend actor.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Provides React Query hooks for fetching and mutating test benches, user profiles, roles, preferences, and related backend data.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base layers and CSS variables for light and dark themes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity providers.
frontend/src/pages/Admin/components/Admi: Empty placeholder for admin benches panel.
Empty placeholder for admin documents panel.
Empty placeholder for admin users panel.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/BenchDetailPa: Displays detailed test bench info with components, documents, history, and edit/remove actions.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/BenchListPage: Lists test benches with search, filtering, and an option to add a new bench.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/Ad: Modal form for creating a test bench with fields for metadata, tags, documents, components, and photo upload.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/Be: Editor table allowing adding, editing, removing bench components and computing expiration status badges.
Manages document categories, uploads, versioning, and deletion for a bench with progress handling.
Displays sorted bench history entries with timestamps, user info, and optional details.
Renders a bench photo with loading and error fallbacks before showing the blob image.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/Do: Form input managing document categories and file uploads with version editing and removal.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/Ed: Modal for editing bench metadata, URLs, tags, description, and updating an optional photo.
frontend/src/pages/Benches/components/Ta: Tag input field supporting adding, removing, and selecting tag suggestions with validation.
Placeholder page describing planned features for creating new benches.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard/components/: Computes component expiration statuses and displays their distribution in a pie chart. Shows message if no components exist.
Aggregates OK, expiring soon, and expired component counts with optional bench filtering and visualizes them as a bar chart. Uses Recharts and dropdowns for interaction.
Groups components into time‑based expiration buckets depending on selected range and renders results as a bar chart. Supports bench and time‑range filtering.
Counts documents by category and displays the distribution in a pie chart. Shows placeholder when no documents are available.
Builds monthly expiration counts for components and visualizes trends as either a bar or line chart. Limits output to the most recent 12 months.
Lists benches with expired components and charts the top ones using bar or line format. Hides chart if no expired items exist.
Calculates system-wide OK, expiring soon, and expired component percentages and visualizes them with progress bars. Displays totals and handles empty datasets.
Renders draggable dashboard statistic and chart cards with saved ordering in localStorage.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Main dashboard page fetching benches, components, and documents, computing expiration stats, and managing section ordering and chart type.
frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx: Profile management page handling user info, thresholds, avatar settings, and saving preferences via backend hooks.
frontend/src/pages/SignInPage.tsx: Simple sign‑in screen using Internet Identity with error display and branded layout.
frontend/src/utils/avatars.ts: Maps avatar IDs to asset paths and provides helpers to retrieve paths and list all avatars.
frontend/src/utils/blobUpload.ts: Uploads a file as an ExternalBlob with optional progress tracking.
frontend/src/utils/defaultBenchPhoto.ts: Fetches and converts the default test bench placeholder image into an ExternalBlob.
frontend/src/utils/download.ts: Downloads an ExternalBlob as a file by generating a temporary URL and triggering browser download.
frontend/src/utils/expirationSettings.ts: Utilities for reading thresholds, computing effective bench thresholds, and determining expiration status.
frontend/src/utils/id.ts: Generates a simple unique ID using timestamp and random string.
frontend/src/utils/rewriteDescription.ts: Heuristically cleans and normalizes bench description text, fixing casing, spacing, and abbreviations.
frontend/src/utils/search.ts: Searches test benches by matching query terms against name, agile code, description, and tags.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers for reading URL parameters (query and hash), persisting them in sessionStorage, and clearing them, with URL values taking precedence.
frontend/src/utils/validation.ts: Implements validation functions for emails, domain-restricted emails, AGILE codes, semantic versions, and URLs.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, fonts, animations, container settings, and plugins such as typography and container queries.
frontend/tsconfig.node.json: TypeScript config for Node-related builds, enabling ESNext modules and including vite.config.ts.
frontend/vite.config.ts: Vite setup for a React app with environment variable loading, path aliasing, dev server proxying, and build output configuration.
project_state.json: Tracks project state, existing features, issues, and pending feature requests for the application's ongoing development.
